variable.name: F153VY
variable.comment: Visit year in which this Form 153 was collected

variable.name: F153DAYS
variable.description: F153 Days since randomization or enrollment
variable.comment: Days since randomization or enrollment to receipt of Form 153

variable.name: F153EXTPHASE
variable.comment: The WHI Extension in which the Form 153 was collected

variable.name: F153CONT
variable.comment: The method used to collect the Form 153 data.

variable.name: F153FINDAYS
variable.comment: Days since randomization or enrollment to completion of Form 153

variable.name: F153SEQ
variable.description: F153 Medication sequence id within form
variable.comment: Unique number assigned sequentially to each medication on a participant's Form 153.

variable.name: F153MEDTYPE
variable.comment: Indicates the section of the Form 153 in which the medication was recorded by the participant. This may or may not correspond to the actual medication type, as participants did not always record their medication in the correct section of the form.
variable.value: Section C: Non-prescription - Natural female hormone
Section D: Dietary supplement - Calcium/Vitamin D
Section D: Dietary supplement - Vitamin D

variable.name: F153MEDNDC
variable.comment: The NDC number (F153MEDNDC) and the NDC version (F153MEDNDCVER) provide a unique identifier for the medication. A description of a medication can be found in the reference file f153ref_meds.dat by merging on the F153MEDNDC and F154MEDNDCVER variables. A list of ingredients contained in a medication can be found in the reference file f153ref_med_ingreds.dat by merging on the F153MEDNDC and F154MEDNDCVER variables. This file is available through dbGaP Authorized Access only.

variable.name: F153MEDNDCVER
variable.description: F153 Medication National Drug Code (NDC) Version
variable.comment: NDC version is a variable created by WHI as a mechanism for tracking changes to a medication's details over time. The NDC number (F153MEDNDC) and the NDC version (F153MEDNDCVER) provide a unique identifier for the medication.

variable.name: F153FREQ
variable.description: F153 How often taking this medication
variable.comment:
Frequency was not collected for prescription medications.
The form value of '2-Less than once a day' for 'Over-the-counter insulin' has been recoded to a '6' for this variable.

variable.name: F153DUR
variable.description: F153 How long taking this medication

variable.name: F153ADULTY
variable.description: F153 Adult years taking this medication
variable.comment: If taking medication for more than one year, then number of years taken since age 20. Sub-question of F153DUR = 'F153 How long taking this medication'

variable.name: F153TCCODE
variable.comment:
A description of a medication therapeutic class can be found in the reference file f153ref_med_classes.dat by merging on the F153TCCODE variable. This file is available through dbGaP Authorized Access only.

The first 2 digits of the Therapeutic Class Code represent the Drug Group. The next 2 digits represent the Drug Class within the Drug Group. The last 2 digits represent the Drug Subclass within the Drug Class.

Example
--------------
Drug Group:
270000 Antidiabetic
Drug Class:
271000 Insulin
Drug Subclass:
271010 Mixed Insulin
271020 Beef Insulin
271030 Pork Insulin
271040 Human Insulin
